alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:55AM PST until January 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 4000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches with locally higher amounts of 20 to 30 inches above 5500 feet. Winds gusting 30 to 50 mph across exposed higher terrain/ * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County above 4000 feet. This includes the Mount Shasta Ski park area and higher portions of Highway 89, especially at Snowmans Summit. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will lower from 5000 feet this morning, down to 4500 feet this afternoon then to between 3500 and 4000 feet this evening and tonight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
